resources.string: Welcome to App Toolkit
Explore the capabilities of the AppToolkit library. Discover applications built to demonstrate the library\'s power and enhance your Android development and user experience.
Discover applications

App Toolkit introduces a selection of applications, each designed to highlight different aspects of the AppToolkit library and enhance your Android experience. See what\'s possible with the AppToolkit library.
See the AppToolkit library in action
This app demonstrates how the AppToolkit library builds versatile, user-focused applications. Explore the sample apps to see different features and implementations of the library.

View on Google Play
What is App Toolkit?
App Toolkit is an application designed to feature and demonstrate apps built with the AppToolkit library. It\'s your guide to exploring this ecosystem and seeing the AppToolkit library in action.
How do I access the different apps shown in App Toolkit?

App Toolkit lists various applications. Tapping on an app listing typically provides more information and a link to install or open it from the Google Play Store, allowing you to experience it firsthand.
Are the apps featured in App Toolkit free?

Many apps featured in App Toolkit offer a core set of features for free. Some may have advanced functionalities available through a premium version or in-app purchases. Details for each app can be found on its respective Play Store page.
How can I learn more about a specific app listed?
For complete details about a listed app, its features, and user reviews, tap the app in App Toolkit to visit its page on the Google Play Store.
Where can I find help or support for one of your listed apps?

Each app has its own support channels, usually detailed on its Play Store page or within the app itself. App Toolkit is for discovering these apps; for app-specific issues, use that app\'s support options.
How often is the list of your apps updated in App Toolkit?
App Toolkit is updated regularly so you always see the latest apps that use the AppToolkit library. New apps or significant updates may be featured here.
Why does App Toolkit need permissions like Internet access?
To show the latest app list, App Toolkit uses Internet access to retrieve information from the Google Play Store and display it accurately. It doesn\'t typically require other invasive permissions.
How can I provide feedback on App Toolkit or your apps?

Your feedback on App Toolkit and its listed apps is appreciated. You can usually find a "Feedback" or "Contact" option within App Toolkit\'s settings or on the developer page on the Play Store. Feedback on the AppToolkit library itself is also welcome through the appropriate channels.
Is my data safe when using App Toolkit to find your other apps?

App Toolkit primarily fetches publicly available information about listed apps. When you choose to install or use one of these apps, that app\'s own Privacy Policy applies, so be sure to review it. App Toolkit\'s data handling is outlined in its Privacy Policy.
